intro: Rhagodia billardierei var. congesta, commonly known as the clustered rhagodia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its erect, spindly stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy soils and is found in arid and semi-arid regions. Its flowers are usually pink or red, and it produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps. This species is adapted to withstand drought conditions and is often found in coastal and inland areas of southern Australia.
